name: BlendLuxCore latest build
body:
These add-on packages are updated to the latest BlendLuxCore commit and contain the latest available LuxCore binaries.

BlendLuxCore commit history:
https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/commits/master

LuxCore commit history:
https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/LuxCore/commits/master

name: BlendLuxCore v2.6
body:
**NOTE: This version is not compatible with Blender v3.0, it requires Blender 2.93LTS.**

* [Installation and Update Instructions](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/BlendLuxCore_Installation)
* [Manual](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/Category:BlendLuxCore)

Changes since last release: 
https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/compare/blendluxcore_v2.5...blendluxcore_v2.6

On Windows, you have to install the following:
* [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2017](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
* [Intel C++ redistributable](https://software.intel.com/sites/default/files/managed/59/aa/ww_icl_redist_msi_2018.3.210.zip)
*

name: BlendLuxCore v2.2
body:
* [Installation and Update Instructions](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/BlendLuxCore_Installation)
* [Manual](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/Category:BlendLuxCore)
* [LuxCore v2.2 Release Notes](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/LuxCoreRender_Release_Notes_v2.2)

Changes since last stable release (on the 2.80 port, not including 2.79 maintenance): https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/compare/blendluxcore_v2.1...blendluxcore_v2.2

On Windows, you have to install the following:
* [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2017](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
* [Intel C++ redistributable](https://software.intel.com/sites/default/files/managed/59/aa/ww_icl_redist_msi_2018.3.210.zip)

### Blender 2.80
This release includes builds for Blender 2.80. They can be found in the asset list at the bottom, containing "blender2.80" in their names. These builds are not as stable and bug-free as the ones for Blender 2.79, but on the other hand they contain more features than the 2.79 builds.

Note that in Blender 2.80, you can not use the auto-updater in the addon preferences to update from v2.2beta3 to v2.2beta4 or later. From v2.2beta4 on it should work.

#### Known Issues
Known issues that will be fixed in the future:
- When using Cycles nodes, nested node groups are not supported
- Cycles light settings are not being used
- Unit scale is currently handled like in Cycles (i.e. ignored)
- When adding nodes to a Cycles node tree while LuxCore is selected as render engine, most nodes in the "shader" category are not available. You'll have to switch to Cycles, add the nodes and then switch back.

#### Reporting Bugs

If you find any bugs, problems, weird UI arrangements, missing tooltips etc. that are not on the list above, please open an issue in our bugtracker: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/new

#### Info
- Here's a video showing how to render a Cycles scene with LuxCore: https://youtu.be/kglbpZl6Sck
- General info about the 2.80 port: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/166
- Info about the state of the Cycles scene reader: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/272
(Not strictly part of the 2.80 port, but started in the course of it)

name: BlendLuxCore v2.2RC1
body:
* [Installation and Update Instructions](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/BlendLuxCore_Installation)
* [Manual](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/Category:BlendLuxCore)
* [LuxCore v2.2 Release Notes](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/LuxCoreRender_Release_Notes_v2.2)

Changes since last release (on the 2.80 port, not including 2.79 maintenance): https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/compare/blendluxcore_v2.2beta4...blendluxcore_v2.2rc1

On Windows, you have to install the following:
* [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2017](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
* [Intel C++ redistributable](https://software.intel.com/sites/default/files/managed/59/aa/ww_icl_redist_msi_2018.3.210.zip)

### Blender 2.80 Testrelease
This release includes testbuilds of the 2.80 version of our addon.
They can be found in the asset list at the bottom, containing "blender2.80" in their names.
Compared to the builds for Blender 2.79 they are still a bit unstable. It is recommended not to use them in production.

Note that in Blender 2.80, you can not use the auto-updater in the addon preferences to update from v2.2beta3 to v2.2beta4 or later. From v2.2beta4 on it should work.

#### Known Issues
Known issues that will be fixed in the future:
- When using Cycles nodes, nested node groups are not supported
- Cycles light settings are not being used
- Unit scale is currently handled like in Cycles (i.e. ignored)

#### Reporting Bugs

If you find any bugs, problems, weird UI arrangements, missing tooltips etc. that are not on the list above, please open an issue in our bugtracker: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/new

#### Info
- Here's a video showing how to render a Cycles scene with LuxCore: https://youtu.be/kglbpZl6Sck
- General info about the 2.80 port: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/166
- Info about the state of the Cycles scene reader: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/272
(Not strictly part of the 2.80 port, but started in the course of it)

body:
* [Installation and Update Instructions](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/BlendLuxCore_Installation)

* [LuxCore v2.2 Release Notes](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/LuxCoreRender_Release_Notes_v2.2)

On Windows, you have to install the following:
* [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2017](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
* [Intel C++ redistributable](https://software.intel.com/sites/default/files/managed/59/aa/ww_icl_redist_msi_2018.3.210.zip)

### Blender 2.80 Testrelease
This release includes testbuilds of the 2.80 version of our addon.
They can be found in the asset list at the bottom, containing "blender2.80" in their names.
**Do not use in production! If you open any of your scenes with it, save it as a copy!**

Note that in Blender 2.80, you can not use the auto-updater in the addon preferences to update from v2.2beta3 to v2.2beta4. 

#### Known Issues
Known issues that will be fixed in the future:
- When using Cycles nodes, nested node groups are not supported
- Cycles light settings are not being used
- Unit scale is currently handled like in Cycles (i.e. ignored)

#### Reporting Bugs

If you find any bugs, problems, weird UI arrangements, missing tooltips etc. that are not on the list above, please open an issue in our bugtracker: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/new

#### Info
- Here's a video showing how to render a Cycles scene with LuxCore: https://youtu.be/kglbpZl6Sck
- General info about the 2.80 port: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/166
- Info about the state of the Cycles scene reader: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/272
(Not strictly part of the 2.80 port, but started in the course of it)

name: BlendLuxCore v2.2beta3
body:
* [Installation and Update Instructions](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/BlendLuxCore_Installation)
* [Manual](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/Category:BlendLuxCore)
* [LuxCore v2.2 Release Notes](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/LuxCoreRender_Release_Notes_v2.2)

Changes since last release (on the 2.80 port, not including 2.79 maintenance): https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/compare/blendluxcore_v2.2beta2...blendluxcore_v2.2beta3

On Windows, you have to install the [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2017](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x64.exe).

### Blender 2.80 Testrelease
This release includes a testbuild of the 2.80 port of our addon: 
[BlendLuxCore_280_Win64_OpenCL.zip](https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/releases/download/blendluxcore_v2.2beta3/BlendLuxCore_280_Win64_OpenCL.zip)
**Do not use in production! If you open any of your scenes with it, save it as a copy!**

#### Known Issues
Known issues that will be fixed in the future:
- Pointiness doesn't work
- Motion blur doesn't work
- When using Cycles nodes, nested node groups are not supported
- Cycles light settings are not being used
- When using LuxCore nodes, some property edits do not trigger a viewport render update (see https://developer.blender.org/T66521)
- Unit scale is currently handled like in Cycles (i.e. ignored)

The UI is not final, there will be some rearrangement and fixes (e.g. the DLSC settings will move into the new "Caches" panel).

#### Reporting Bugs

If you find any bugs, problems, weird UI arrangements, missing tooltips etc. that are not on the list above, please open an issue in our bugtracker: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/new

Note that I am on vacation from 08.08.19 to 24.08.19. I will work on your reports when I get back.

#### Info
- Here's a video showing how to render a Cycles scene with LuxCore: https://youtu.be/kglbpZl6Sck
- General info about the 2.80 port: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/166
- Info about the state of the Cycles scene reader: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/issues/272
(Not strictly part of the 2.80 port, but started in the course of it)

Unfortunately, due to the complicated setup required to create a 2.80 build of our addon, we only offer a build for 64bit Windows with OpenCL. The future final release of the 2.80 port will of course be built for Windows and Linux again (and maybe macOS).
Also, pyluxcoretools is not included, so network render does not work with this testbuild.

name: BlendLuxCore v2.1beta3 with Optix integration
body:
**Note:** The Optix integration is now obsolete because we have integrated Intel's OpenImageDenoise (OIDN) into LuxCore v2.2 (even with viewport denoising). **Download the [latest release](https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/releases) instead.**

---

This is an experimental release which includes an integration of Nvidia's Optix denoiser in the viewport render.
The denoiser is started once the viewport render is paused. It denoises in the background without blocking Blender's interface.
**Demo Video: https://youtu.be/mSgNaBvrftE**

You have to install the [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2017](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x64.exe).
You also need one of the Optix integration addons for Blender, for example:
* https://remingtongraphics.net/tools/d-noise/
* https://github.com/troopy28/OptiX-Denoiser-for-Blender

I recommend that you first install the Optix addon, then this BlendLuxCore version afterwards. In this order, BlendLuxCore will be able to auto-detect the Optix binaries.
To enable Optix in the viewport, open the render properties, navigate to the LuxCore Viewport Settings panel and check "Use Optix". 

### Download: 
[**BlendLuxCore v2.1beta3_optix Windows 64bit OpenCL**](https://www.dropbox.com/s/kzhukccgoxrktem/BlendLuxCore-v2.1beta3_optix-win64-opencl.zip?dl=1)

[Installation and Update Instructions](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/BlendLuxCore_Installation)
[Manual](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/Category:BlendLuxCore)

name: BlendLuxCore v2.1alpha4
body:
* [Installation and Update Instructions](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/BlendLuxCore_Installation)
* [Manual](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/Category:BlendLuxCore)
* [LuxCore v2.1 Release Notes](https://wiki.luxcorerender.org/LuxCoreRender_Release_Notes_v2.1)

Changes since last release: https://github.com/LuxCoreRender/BlendLuxCore/compare/blendluxcore_v2.1alpha3...blendluxcore_v2.1alpha4

On Windows, you have to install the [Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable for Visual Studio 2017](https://aka.ms/vs/15/release/vc_redist.x64.exe).
**Note for Windows users:** due to a [bug](https://github.com/embree/embree/issues/195) in Embree v3.2.0, you need to install the [Intel C++ redistributable](https://software.intel.com/sites/default/files/managed/59/aa/ww_icl_redist_msi_2018.3.210.zip).
